item.description:
A bollard has been placed over the sign and needs remiving

item.title: Overgrown tree in neighbour’s council garden blocking sunlight, 19th September
item.description:
There is a large overgrown tree in my neighbour’s garden, which is a Hackney Council property. The tree has become very high and is blocking sunlight into our garden. It is intrusive, overgrown, and needs maintenance/pruning

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lansdowne Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public bin outside 226 Baker street is full of litter, 19th September
item.description:
The public bin located outside the pavement of 226 Baker street next to Baker street station bus stop A is full of litter. The bin needs to be emptied.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Allsop Place, Marylebone, London

item.title: Dangerous materials dumped, 19th September
item.description:
Come on hackney council -this is getting worse by the week. its a fire hazard and a DANGER TO HEALTH. there's been fires here before.

item.title: Outside the corner of Hodge House, South Kilburn, 19th September
item.description:
I would like to report serious damage to the pavement at the above location. The road in this area is very narrow, and because there are too many parking spaces on the opposite side, large lorries and smaller cars are frequently driving over the pavement or even using it as a parking area. This has caused: Severe damage to the pavement surface, creating potholes and uneven ground. Increased risk to the public, especially as there is a nursery directly opposite with many small children regularly using the pavement. Requested action: The pavement urgently needs to be repaired and replaced. A permanent solution should be implemented to prevent further damage, such as: Installing barriers or bollards to stop vehicles from driving onto the pavement. Reviewing and removing the parking spaces on the opposite side of the road to ease congestion. This situation poses a real danger to children, parents, and other members of the public, and I would appreciate urgent action.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Granville Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collection bin dumped., 19th September
item.description:
This revolting bin has been dumped here since early August if not before. That corner is a magnet for rubbish at the best of times so who knows what's in it. It needs moving, fast. The people who live near must be less than enchanted.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wordsworth Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary road barriers fallen over and left behind after building of new bicycle parking, 19th September
item.description:
Works seem to have been completed a few weeks ago on the new bicycle parking opposite Neil House. But plastic road barriers that have been left behind are now fallen in a pile with some drifting off into the road/ traffic.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven dangerous paving slabs, 19th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Canonbury Park North, Highbury, London

item.title: Vulnerable person sleeping in tent and blocking pavement throughfare, 19th September
item.description:
This woman has been sleeping on Rowhill Rd in the tent all this week and moved outside 1-6 Rowhill Mansions on Tuesday night, blocking our side gate, a designated fire exit, and blocking the pavement. Her refusal to move is causing distress to residents.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rowhill Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant litter placed on the Electrical box, 19th September
item.description:
Litter, empty alcohol bottles and cans are constantly left on or by the electrical box - it is very unsightly and as soon as it is removed, more appears the next morning. Rubbish including dog poo bags are constantly left on the wall of 265 beckenham road. Please can a public bin be placed on the corner to avoid this happening.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birkbeck Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Lime Bike, 19th September
item.description:
This has been here for more than a month, reported multiple times but it is still here. Please would the owner collect their dumped bike?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Challin Street, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 20 Spencer Walk, 19th September
item.description:
There is a lot of white mould on the exterior wall of Spencer Walk where it meets Gardnor Road. It’s causing damp issues and could be dangerous to health. It has been reported many times to Spencer Walk management over the years but they have taken no action. We believe it could be a risk to public health.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gardnor Road, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cobblestone collapsed with gap underneath, 19th September
item.description:
Cobblestone seems to have collapse and there is a gap underneath. Other cobblestones nearby seem at risk of collapsing as well. Could be dangerous if a car were to drive over it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Collington Street, East Greenwich, London
